body:
I am debugging Case 2, `--config NUL`, on Windows.

This part:

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/ddb7eb6e0a9b07ad7be443b6c6f64bd7f372307d/fs/config/configflags/configflags.go#L271

Ends up in Windows API function GetFullPathNameW, which for "NUL" returns the special device path "\\\\.\\NUL", but then golang's filepath.Abs does a "Clean" before returning and it transforms it to "\\NUL".

But not only that: Even something like `--config NUL.conf` ends up being transformed to "\\NUL".



> If the path is a legacy DOS device such as CON, COM1, or LPT1, it is converted into a device path by prepending \\\\.\\ and returned.
>
> A path that begins with a legacy device name is always interpreted as a legacy device by the Path.GetFullPath(String) method. For example, the DOS device path for CON.TXT is \\\.\\CON, and the DOS device path for COM1.TXT\file1.txt is \\\\.\\COM1.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/io/file-path-formats#handle-legacy-devices

>Do not use the following reserved names for the name of a file:
>
> CON, PRN, AUX, NUL, COM1, COM2, COM3, COM4, COM5, COM6, COM7, COM8, COM9, LPT1, LPT2, LPT3, LPT4, LPT5, LPT6, LPT7, LPT8, and LPT9. Also avoid these names followed immediately by an extension; for example, NUL.txt is not recommended. For more information, see Namespaces.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-gb/windows/win32/fileio/naming-a-file?redirectedfrom=MSDN

@ncw: I don't know if this warrants a general fix, or its enough with quick and dirty:
- Update doc, "NUL" is no longer supported/allowed for config option on Windows as it states today.
- `if runtime.GOOS == "windows"` and then a regex to detect these names before calling filepath.Abs in configflags

Here is the commit that introduced the feature bb0b6432ae5d74a741815a8cc1f0cf2d46e3dddb

Note that these errors are saying you made a config with no config file `:sftp:` so we can't save it. These are to be expected. Maybe they shouldn't be ERROR though.

> 2021/04/07 22:02:23 ERROR : Can't save config "md5sum_command" = "md5sum" for on the fly backend ":sftp"
> 2021/04/07 22:02:23 ERROR : Can't save config "sha1sum_command" = "sha1sum" for on the fly backend ":sftp"

I can't immediately see the problem with 3. & 4 - are you OK to dig into this more?

With 1. & 2. maybe we should check for `os.DevNull` in `func (s *Storage) noConfig()` to fix both 1. & 2. ?
I can dig some more, yes.

issue.title: config: fix issues with memory-only config file paths

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

Solving issues and making it more user friendly with memory-only config.

Ref the following cases described in the issue:

Case 1. --config /dev/null on Linux
Case 2. --config NUL on Windows
Case 3. --config ""
Case 4. --config /notfound (**note:** PR https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/5235 extends this to any path with basename "notfound")

All should be handled by this PR, ~~but I have only tested on Windows~~ tested on Windows 10 and arch linux in WSL.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Fixes #5222

#### Checklist

- [X] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [X] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [X] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [X] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [X] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
> @ncw ; I'm wondering about this:
> https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/f52ae75a51a04188d728d8888112fb1fedb6c519/fs/fs.go#L1319-L1321
> 
> I'm thinking of changing it to Logf, but wondering: It does not return, but continues calling ConfigFileSet, doesn't that end up saving (or trying to) the config after all? I haven't been able to trigger it to test it yet, so just from reading the code..

Logf sounds good, and yes, duh, it needs to return and not continue!

issue.title: Regression: --version requires configuration password

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
In v1.50.2, running `rclone --version` with an encrypted config file would output the version.

In v1.55.0, the same command asks for the configuration password first. This should not be necessary, as none of the information output by `--version` seems related to the configuration.

```
$ rclone --version
Enter configuration password:
password:
rclone v1.55.0
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.16.2
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: cmount
```

(Also, the password prompt is doubled, but that's a separate issue.)
